application_type_full: Outline planning permission: Some matters reserved
description: Redevelopment of site for the provision of 34, 522 square metres of Class B1(c) (light industrial), Class B2 (general industrial) and Class B8 (storage & distribution) floorspace, with associated parking and new vehicular access from Oldfield Lane North (Outline Application including approval of means of access)
decision_conditions: Approval of the details of the siting, design and external appearance of the buildings and landscaping  (called "the reserved matters") shall be obtained from the Local Planning Authority in writing before any development is commenced.  REASON: The application is in outline form only and is not accompanied by detailed plans. | Application for the approval of all the reserved matters shall be made to the Local Planning Authority before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby permitted shall be begun either before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission or before the expiration of two years from the date of approval of the last of the reserved matters to be approved, whichever is the later.  REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | No goods or materials shall be stacked or deposited on the site, and no operations carried out unless within a roofed and enclosed building.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of nearby occupiers, and to safeguard the visual appearance of the area and adjoining Canal, in accordance with Policies 3.2 and 4.1 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policy 4.1 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | The premises shall only be used for B8 (Warehouse) or B1 ( b), ( c )  (Light Industrial) or B2 (General Industrial) purposes and for no other purposes including primary offices, and retail or wholesale cash and carry purposes.  REASON: To accord with the terms of the submitted application and to ensure that an inappropriate use does not arise within the Major Employment Location in the interest of the character of the area, local environmental amenity and the safety and free flow of vehicular and pedestrian traffic, in accordance with Policies 6.1 and 6.4 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | Details for the installation, operation and maintenance of the best practicable (paint spray), (powder coating) arrestment plant including details of the height of the exhaust stack shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the commencement of the development hereby approved.  Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the development and shall thereafter be retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with Policy 4.1 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | No development shall commence until details of general access together with parking provision for people with disabilities have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Such details as are approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development hereby permitted and shall thereafter be retained.  REASON: To ensure adequate access for people with disabilities, in accordance with Policy 4.3 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | Before the development is commenced, a detailed site investigation shall be carried out to establish if the site is contaminated, to assess the degree and nature of the contamination present, and to determine its potential for the pollution of the water environment.  The method and extent of this site investigation shall be agreed with the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of work.  Details of appropriate measures to prevent pollution of groundwater and surface water, including provisions for monitoring, shall then be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the commencement of the development hereby approved.  Such details shall be carried out in strict accordance with the measures approved and permanently retained.  REASON: To prevent pollution of the water environment, in accordance with Policy 2.5 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with Policy 4.5 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be completed prior to the first occupation of the development.    Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.   REASON: To protect the amenity of the area, in accordance with Policy 4.1 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | Dustinbin and enclosed refuse and recycling areas, details of which shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of any development, shall be sited a maximum of 10 metres from any road or area that refuse vehicles are able to access within the estate. The approved details shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any part of the development and permanently retained thereafter.   REASON: To ensure satisfactory refuse and recycling facilities are provided in accordance with Policies 2.10 and 4.1 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | Details of car parking provision and pedestrian access in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any works commence on site.  Such provision as is approved to be brought into use prior to the first occupation of any part of the development permitted and retained permanently.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking and pedestrian within the site, in accordance with Policy 9.1 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | Details of the noise exposure at existing sensitive buildings and noise mitigation measures in accordance with the Council's 'Guidance for Developers - Planning and Noise Criteria for Dwellings and Other Noise Sensitive Buildings' shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved.  Such details as approved shall be implemented on site prior to the first occupation of the site and thereafter permanently retained.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with Policy 4.11 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | Surface and foul drainage works and source control measures shall be carried out in accordance with details which will have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before development commences. Such details as approved shall be carried out prior to first occupation and shall be permanently retained.  REASON: To prevent the increased risk of flooding and pollution of the water environment, in accordance with Policy 2.5 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | Details of any phasing of the development including site preparation works, shall be submitted to, and shall be approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of any works on site.  The details of phasing shall include any temporary measures relating to the redirection of traffic for the duration of the works on the respective phase of development.  REASON:  To ensure that any phasing of the development is properly co-ordinated and carried out in the sequence agreed by the local planning authority, in the interest of neighbouring amenity and the safety and free flow of vehicular and pedestrian traffic on the neighbouring highways, in accordance with Policy 9.1 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | The rating noise level emitted from the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1 m from the nearest first floor or higher noise sensitive facade.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with Policy 4.1 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | Details shall be submitted (if relevant) to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the commencement of the development hereby approved for the installation, operation and maintenance of the best available dust filtration plant for silos and also for a high level alarm and cut out device to prevent overfilling and escape of dust.  Such details as approved shall be implemented on site prior to the first occupation of the development and thereafter permanently retained.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with Policies 2.6 and 4.1 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | Details of the chimney height under Section 6 of the Clean Air Act 1993 for incinerators/furnaces shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the commencement of the development hereby approved.  Such details as approved shall be implemented on site prior to the first occupation of the development and shall thereafter be retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with Policies 2.6 and 4.1 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | Details of boilers/furnaces shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in accordance with Section 4 of the Clean Air Act 1993 prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved.  Such details as approved shall be implemented on site prior to the first occupation of the development and shall thereafter be retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with Policies 2.6 and 4.1 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | An air quality impact assessment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved.  REASON: To ensure that the development meets the Local Planning Authority's air quality objectives in order to safeguard the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with Policy 2.6 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | Details of cooking facilities  to demonstrate that they are operated and maintained with the best practicable odour abatement equipment shall be submitted to approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with Policy 4.1 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | Before any works commence on site, details of a scheme to provide parking for cyclists in accordance with adopted standards shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and thereafter retained.  REASON: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with Policy 9.6 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | No part of the development permitted shall be occupied or brought into use before the junction between the proposed service road and the highway has been constructed as approved so as to allow insofar as they can be achieved within the land under the control of the applicant sight lines of  4.5.m, by 7.0m, and that land shall be kept clear of any obstructions to visibility above a height of 0.6m.  REASON: In the interest of highway safety and in accordance with Policy 9.1 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | Notwithstanding the details of landscaping required under Condition 10 of this approval, details of a scheme of environmental improvements, tree planting etc measures along the site's common boundary with the Grand Union Canal Towpath shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the commencement of the development hereby approved.  Such details as approved shall be implemented on site prior to the first occupation of the development and shall thereafter be retained.  REASON:  To protect the visual character and amenity of the Grand Union Canal Towpath in particular and the area in general, in accordance with Policy 3.2 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | The maximum floor space shall not exceed 34,522 square metres, and no mezzanine floor shall be provided within any of the buildings without the prior written approval from the local planning authority.  REASON:  To ensure that the floor space to be provided within the site is not exceeded and to prevent an over-intensification of use of the site, in accordance with Policies 4.1 and 9.1 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | No soakaways shall be constructed in contaminated ground without prior written approval from the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To prevent the pollution of groundwater, in accordance with Policy 2.5 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | The construction of the site foundations shall be carried out in accordance with details submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development commences  REASON: To prevent the pollution of groundwater, in accordance with Policy 2.5 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004 | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced to demonstrate that the potential for nuisance from glare and illuminance will be reduced by correctly aiming and shielding the luminaires to control vertical illuminance with the lights operating to a maximum of 10 lux at ground level and 5 lux at first floor level at any affected facade.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with Policies 2.6 and 4.1 of the adopted London Borough of Ealing UDP 2004. | Deleted.
site_number: Land South Of Auriol Drive Adjoining
